This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove.
You are carrying a message from King Brand to Grimbeorn through Mirkwood Forest.
You awaken to find that giant spiders have captured your friends.
After escaping giant spiders, you find yourself lost in the vastness of Mirkwood.
You have found the mighty Anduin but you must still journey downriver to Grimbeorn.
You reach the Carrock only to discover that Grimbeorn has been captured by Trolls!

The King of Dale has entrusted you with an urgent letter for Grimbeorn the Old, chieftain of the Beornings that dwell in the Anduin Vale. To reach his house you must journey through the shadowy forest of Mirkwood. Not long after entering the forest, you are surrounded by evil creatures.

You are traveling deeper into Mirkwood along an overgrown trail when giant spiders ambush your party. They wrap one of your friends in a silken cocoon with horrifying speed, then drag their captive off to be devoured. You cannot abandon your companion to such a fate.
You have rescued your friend, but you quickly decide that your only chance of escape is to fight your way out. You turn to face the swarm of spiders and begin your assault!
You have rescued your friend, but the spiders of Mirkwood continue to swarm around you. Realizing you are in danger of being overwhelmed, you decide to make a run for it!

Though you have escaped the spiders—at least for now—you find yourself far from the main trail. Searching tirelessly, you at last spy the path on the far side of a dark, unnatural-looking stream. As you look for a place to ford, a giant creature emerges from the underbrush to attack!

Having traveled deep into Mirkwood on the mission to find Grimbeorn, your party camps for the night. You wake from a troubled sleep to find yourself very much alone. What you thought was but a dream—the sound of countless legs scuttling around your camp and hundreds of bulbous eyes peering from the dark—was all too real. The giant spiders of Mirkwood have carried off your friends while you slept. It is now up to you to rescue them!

Searching through the night, you find your friends being held within a dark glade, surrounded by giant spider webs. They have been bound in cocoons made of strong webbed cords. They beg you to cut them free, but before you can try the spiders descend from the trees to attack you.

You've managed to cut your companions loose, but the spiders are determined to recapture you. They spin giant webs from tree to tree, trapping you in their den. You will have to cut your way through them in order to escape.

You hack through the spiders’ webs but advance only a short distance when an enormous spider appears, blocking your escape! Her many offspring gather behind you, cutting off any retreat. There is no turning back. You must defeat Ungoliant's spawn.

You have escaped from the spiders’ dark colony, only to find yourself lost in the vastness of Mirkwood. The forest is so dark and tangled that it is impossible to know which direction to travel. You must find some landmarks to get your bearings.
A stream winds between the twisted roots of ancient trees that crowd the riverbank. Traveling this way is hard work. You wonder if you should continue or search for a better path.

A sea of green spreads for miles in all directions from your view atop a low hill. Scanning the horizon, you notice a faint trail of grey smoke rising in the distance. Do you head for the smoke, or do you keep searching for a path out of the forest?

At long last, the stream you have been following leads to a wide bog. You must be near the Anduin River vale—but reaching the mighty river requires crossing the swamp. Who knows what dangers lie in wait?
After a long, desperate search you find a trail at last. Though it is overgrown and littered with animal tracks, you believe this path leads to the Anduin vale.

Navigating toward the smoke as best you can through the dense forest, you find the remains of an old Woodmen village near the eaves of Mirkwood. Yet your relief is short-lived—the village overrun is with Orcs! As they spot your weary group, it becomes clear that you must fight to reach the Anduin vale.

Emerging from Mirkwood Forest, you continue your mission to deliver an urgent message to Grimbeorn. You make your way south along the Anduin River toward the land of the Beornings. As you approach the location of a small raft stashed on the riverbank, a fearsome Hill Troll emerges from behind a grouping of rocks, and attacks!

Having defeated the Troll, you board a raft and float downriver. You barely have time to catch your breath before more enemies emerge along the river bank in pursuit, harassing the small vessel as you attempt to navigate the river.
Ongoing harassment from your enemies forces your raft to the shore. You must confront their ambush head on. If you survive this attack, the rest of your journey down the Anduin should be clear.

The Anduin river has carried you south from the Forest Gate to the land of the Beornings, where you hope to deliver King Brand’s message to their chieftain, Grimbeorn. However, when you pull your raft to shore, the Beornings tell you that Grimbeorn was last seen roaming as a great bear toward the Carrock. To find him, you must continue south along the riverbank.
After a day spent following Grimbeorn's trail, you make a startling discovery: a group of Trolls has captured the great chieftain, and plans to eat him! You draw your weapons and rush to his rescue.

Once freed from his chains, Grimbeorn joins you in your battle against the Trolls. “A barrel of beer to the one who brings me a Troll’s head!” he roars while swinging a mighty blow at the nearest foe.
Welcome to The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game! Aragorn and Arwen are ambushed while traveling through Mirkwood Forest…
Aragorn and Arwen venture deeper into the forest…
Make your way through Mirkwood Forest.
Overcome "Cocoon" and rescue the captive Hero to allow travel.
Defeat each Enemy in play to allow travel.
Overcome "Find the Path" to allow travel.
Defeat "Marsh Adder" to complete the Quest.
Overcome "Find Your Friends" to unlock travel.
Overcome "Rescue Your Friends" to unlock travel.
Overcome "Escape the Spiders" to unlock travel.
Defeat "Ungoliant's Spawn" to complete the Quest.
Overcome "Follow the Stream" to advance immediately to Forest Stream OR overcome "Climb the Hill" to advance immediately to Bare Hilltop.
Overcome "Continue Downstream" to advance immediately to Mirkwood Swamp OR overcome "Search for a Path" to advance immediately to Overgrown Trail.
Overcome "Investigate the Smoke" to advance immediately to Abandoned Village OR overcome "Search for a Path" to advance immediately to Overgrown Trail.
Defeat "Giant Marsh Worm" to complete the Quest.
Overcome "Escape the Forest" to complete the Quest.
Defeat the last Enemy in play to complete the Quest.
Defeat the last Enemy in play to complete the Quest.
Overcome: Defeat all Enemies and Search the Area.
You have made it across the enchanted river. With its dark waters between you and your pursuers, you are free to continue your journey through Mirkwood Forest.
You have defeated Ungoliant's spawn and rescued your friends.

Against all odds, you have escaped from Mirkwood Forest and reached the vales of Anduin on the western end. The next leg of your journey will take you down the Anduin River to the land of the Beornings.
You have driven back your pursuers and are free to continue your journey downriver.
"That was fine work," exclaims Grimbeorn after the last Troll falls. Having rescued the Beorning's chieftain, at long last you can deliver King Brand's message and complete your mission.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.

Reduce a non-unique Enemy to 0 Attack until the end of the round.

Guarded (Hill Troll). Resolve: Allow travel from this Location.
Resolve: The captured cards return to their owner's hand.

Resolve: Travel immediately to Forest Stream.
End of round: Add 1 Forest Flies at 0 cost.
Stealth. While Sauron has 0 Resources, Frodo gains +2 Willpower.
Ranged. Arrival: Deal 1 damage to an Enemy.
Fleeting. Arrival (choose): Draw 3 cards, reduce your Threat by 3, or deal 3 damage to an Enemy.
Reduce each Ally to 0 Willpower until the end of the round.
Stealth. X Willpower (X equals the number of Objectives in play).
Stalwart. Vigilant. Forced: When Giant Marsh Worm attacks, defending player's Threat increases by 1.
Stalwart. After Gimli takes damage, he gains +2 Attack until the end of the round.
Ranged. Stealth. Upkeep: Deal 1 damage to a random player Character.
Heal 4 damage from each Hobbit Character.
Choose a Character with a weapon Attachment to gain Protect.
Resolve: Allow travel from this Location.
Attach (Hobbit Hero). Upkeep: Sauron loses 1 Resource.
Choose a Hero in your discard pile. That Hero returns to play exhausted.
Choose: Raise your Threat by 1 for each Ally you control, or discard an Ally you control.
Arrival: Heal 2 damage from a Character.
Resolve: Travel immediately to Abandoned Village.
Ranged. Ithilien Archer gains +1 Attack for each exhausted Enemy.
Resolve: Heal 2 damage from all player Characters.
Attach: Gain +1 Attack for each Resource in your pool (limit +3 Attack).
Ranged. Upkeep: Deal 1 damage to an Enemy.
Ready a Character and heal 2 damage from it.
Capture 2 random cards from each player's hand.
Forced: After a player plays a card, that player's Threat increases by 1.
Ranged. Arrival: Exhaust a non-unique Enemy.
Quick. Muck Adder attacks the player Character with the lowest current Health.
Resolve: Allow travel from this Location.

Forced: When Orc Marauder attacks, Sauron gains 1 Resource.
Pursuit. Upkeep: Pack of Wargs gains +1 Health.
Prep: Next Character a Spider attack damages but does not defeat cannot ready until after Upkeep.
Prep: Exhaust the next Ally that enters play.

Deal 1 damage to each Enemy in play.
Attach: Gain +1 Attack. When attacked, deal 1 damage to the attacking Enemy.

Resolve: Take control of Grimbeorn and travel immediately to The Carrock.

Arrival: Choose a character to gain Stealth until the end of the round.
Put a random Ally into play under your control. That Ally gains Fleeting.
Each Hatchling Spider gains +1 Attack and Sentinel. Upkeep: Add 1 Hatchling Spider at 0 cost.

Prep: Next attacking Enemy takes damage equal to target's Attack (dealt before Enemy attack hits).

This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove.
Welcome to The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game!
Aragorn and Arwen are ambushed while traveling through Mirkwood Forest.
Aragorn and Arwen are Heroes. They begin the game in play. Heroes are powerful, but your journey will come to an end if they are all defeated.
This is an Enemy. You will encounter many of them during your adventures.
This is a Main Objective. Every Location has one. It tells you what you must do to move on to the next stage of your Quest.

The game is played in rounds, which have two phases: Planning and Adventure. Sauron goes first in each. On your turn in the Planning phase, you play cards to boost your Characters' abilities or prepare against Sauron.
To play a card, select and drag it to the play area. Play Mithrandir's Advice.

Playing a card requires spending Resources equal to the cost in its upper left corner. You get Resources at the start of each round, and by playing certain cards. Play Gaining Strength to get a Resource.
Allies help your Heroes. Play Guard of the Citadel to your player area.
You have played all the cards you can for now. Select the END PHASE button.

After you finish Planning, the
 Adventure phase begins.
 You take turns with Sauron
 during this phase, and may
 attack Enemies or
 engage Objectives.
In an attack, attacker and defender inflict damage on one another equal to their Attack values. Both Characters are then exhausted. A Character reduced to 0 Health is defeated.
Now it's your turn! Use Aragorn to attack the East Bight Patrol.
Aragorn's 2 Attack value drops the East Bight Patrol to 0 Health. The Enemy is defeated.

Once you overcome
 a Main Objective, you may
 travel to the next Location.
Select the TRAVEL button to continue your Quest.
This is the Threat meter. Your Threat increases at the end of each round and when you travel. If you reach 50 Threat, your Quest fails.
Aragorn and Arwen venture deeper into the forest.
Upkeep occurs at the start of each round. Some Characters have abilities that you may use at this time. Use Arwen's ability to heal Aragorn.
In addition to Enemies, Sauron can also play Attachments and Events. These cards have a variety of effects, from impeding your progress to damaging your Characters directly.
Some cards have keywords, which grant additional abilities. Play Horseback Archer, which has the Ranged keyword.
When making a ranged attack on an exhausted target, the attacker takes no damage. Use Horseback Archer to finish off the Hatchling Spider.
Use Aragorn to defeat the last Enemy.
Some cards have special Powers. Select Aragorn, then select his Power to spend 1 Resource and ready him.
You use Willpower to engage an Objective. Select Aragorn and drag him to Search the Area.
Your Characters are exhausted. Select the END PHASE button.
A new round has begun. Use Arwen's ability to heal one of your Characters.

A Character with the Sentinel
 keyword must be defeated before
 you can target other Enemies
 or Objectives.
You can use Attachments to enhance Characters. To equip an Attachment, play the card, then select a Hero or Ally. Equip Aragorn with the Warrior Sword.
Use what you've learned to defeat the Dol Guldur Orcs and Search the Area.

Excellent work!
 Now, finish off the Orcs to
 complete your Quest.
Excellent work! Now you can Search the Area to complete your Quest.

Congratulations! You have completed the tutorial, but that was merely the beginning. Create an Asmodee.net account now to unlock Heroes, Quests, and more. Here is all that you shall receive to start your own adventures in Middle-earth…
Campaign - including the first Quest free!

This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove.
You take turns with Sauron during this phase, and may attack Enemies or engage Objectives.
The first Campaign in The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game.
When a Character with this keyword attacks, it gains an additional Attack value equal to the number listed with it.

A card type representing friends, followers, creatures, and hirelings that assist your Heroes on their Quest. Allies play from your hand and remain in play until they are defeated or removed from play by a card effect.
The keyword for a card ability that triggers immediately after a Character enters play.
A keyword which indicates a card must be attached to a Character.

A card type representing armor, weapons, or special abilities. Unless the Attachment states otherwise, it modifies or influences only the Character to which it is equipped. A Character can have only one Attachment of each trait at a time. If a card with an Attachment leaves play, the Attachment is discarded as well.
A Character's effectiveness when attacking or defending in combat.
An Attachment trait. A Character can have only one Attachment of each trait at a time.
The icon shown in your profile.
A reward available in the Palantir or when playing on Hard difficulty. You can use 5 Beacon Torches to unlock a Hero Pack of your choice.
Each time a Character with this keyword takes damage, it reduces by 1 the damage applied.
A series of 5 Quests that tell a larger story.

The first time a player logs into the game every 24 hours, the game generates a random challenge tied to a random unlocked Quest. The player receives a Valor reward (and potential additional rewards) for completing each daily challenge.
Also called in-game achievements, these are passive achievements tracked over the lifetime of a player's account.

A card type that refers to all Heroes and Allies. When you have the option to select a Character, you can choose any Hero or Ally in play. Enemies are also considered Characters, and may also be valid choices for certain effects that target Characters.

All player and Sauron cards have a cost in the upper-left hand corner. This is the number of Resources that must be spent in order to play the card. Hero cards do not have a cost, since they begin the game in play.
When a Character with this keyword defends, it gains an additional Attack value equal to the number listed with it.
The term for when a Character is removed from play, whether by falling to 0 Health or some other means.

A rating of how challenging Sauron will be in the Quest. There are three difficulty ratings: Easy, Normal, and Hard. Sauron's Resources increase as the difficulty goes up, but you can gain greater rewards — if you survive the Quest!
Men of the West, who settled mainly in Arnor and Gondor.
The act of committing a Character to an Objective.
A card type that covers any tactical action, scheme, twist of fate, or other effect that occurs during the game. An Event resolves immediately when played; the card is then discarded.
A card is exhausted when it is used. All exhausted cards ready during Upkeep.
This is an expendable card that you can use to get an immediate in-game effect. You can add a single Favor Card to your deck at the start of a Quest.
A Character with this keyword leaves play and is discarded at the end of the round.
This keyword refers to an ability that cannot be canceled or avoided.
A race of Middle-earth. All Goblins are Orcs, but not all Orcs are Goblins.
The most prominent kingdom of Men in Middle-earth.
Players cannot engage an Objective with this keyword while an Enemy is in play.
The amount of damage a Character can suffer before being defeated.

A Hero is a main Character that you control during a Quest. Heroes can engage Enemies or Objectives, and may have additional Powers that you can use. Heroes also form the foundation of each deck you create: the Heroes you choose determine the Spheres from which you can choose cards to build your deck. Heroes start the game in play, and have a Threat value instead of a cost. If all your Heroes are defeated, you fail the Quest.
A fixed pack of 5 cards. Each pack includes 1 Hero, plus 1 card from each Sphere of Influence.
A race of gentle beings who have a reputation for preferring a settled life over excitement and adventure.
Wizards such as Gandalf and Saruman who are more than mortal and possessed of great age and power.
This Sphere of Influence emphasizes charismatic and inspirational influence. It represents the potential to lead, inspire, and command Allies and other Heroes alike.
A distinct stage of a Quest. Completing a Quest requires advancing through a series of Locations.
This Sphere of Influence emphasizes the mind's potential. Intellect, wisdom, experience, and specialized knowledge are all under the domain of Lore.
One of the races of Middle-earth; the term is not gender-specific.
The land in which the many adventures of The Lord of the Rings take place.
The keyword for a card ability that triggers immediately when a Character is defeated.
The second clan of the Elves.

This represents a task that you may face in the course of a Quest. Objectives can hinder or complicate your path to victory, and must often be overcome before you can advance to the next Location. Overcoming Objectives requires using Willpower and/or defeating an Enemy.
This is the primary goal you must complete before you can advance to the next Location.
You can use Palantir views to gain rewards such as cards and Valor Points.
During this phase, you and Sauron take turns playing Allies, Attachments, and Events from your respective hands.
These are any Ally, Attachment, and Event cards you use throughout a Quest. Each player card belongs to one of the four Spheres — Leadership, Lore, Spirit, Tactics — or is neutral.

This is a combination of Ally, Attachment, and Event cards from which you draw your cards throughout a Quest. Each deck has 30 cards, and cannot have more than 2 copies of any individual card. A player deck is based on 3 Heroes of your choice, which determine the Spheres from which you can choose cards for your deck.
This is a card ability that you can activate manually on your turn. Depending on the description, a Power may be activated only once per round or multiple times.
An abbreviated form of the "Preparation" keyword.
This applies to an Event card whose effect doesn't trigger immediately. Instead, it activates at a timing window or circumstance described in the card text.
The amount by which an Objective's Quest points are reduced each time Willpower is applied.
The next time a Character with this keyword takes damage, that damage is canceled. This Character then loses Protect.
A Character with this keyword follows your Heroes from one Location to the next.
A specific adventure made up of between 3 and 5 Locations.
The amount of Willpower required to resolve an Objective.
A reward available in the Palantir or when playing on Hard difficulty. You can use 5 Quest Stars to unlock a Quest of your choice.

A Character with this keyword resolves their attack completely before the opposing Character's attack begins. If this defeats the opposing Character, its attack never occurs; otherwise, the opposing Character attack applies as normal.
A Character with this keyword does not take damage when attacking an exhausted target.
All player cards belong to one of the listed rarities: Starter, Hero Pack, Common, Uncommon, Rare, Legendary. The less common a card is, the more potent its abilities.
The act of completing, overcoming, or otherwise removing an Objective.

This is a pool you can use during your turn to play cards from your deck. You start each game with 1 Resource for each Hero in your deck. During Upkeep every round, you also get 1 Resource for each Hero you have in play.
This keyword refers to an effect that occurs in a specific timing window.
The kingdom between the Misty Mountains and White Mountains. Its people are known for their skill on horseback.
A Character with this keyword must be defeated before any non-Sentinel Characters can be attacked.
The second Campaign in The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game.
Woodland Elves. Less interested in knowledge than in combat, compared to their Noldor cousins.
An Attachment trait. A Character can have only one Attachment of each trait at a time.

There are four Spheres of Influence: Leadership, Lore, Spirit, Tactics. Each focuses on the strengths of a particular personality aspect. Every Hero belongs to a Sphere, which dictates the cards you can include in a deck.
This Sphere of Influence emphasizes strength of will and aspects of the supernatural. Determination, courage, loyalty, and heart all fall within this Sphere.
A Character with this keyword does not exhaust the first time it is attacked.
A Character with this keyword cannot be attacked unless all of this player's non-Stealth Characters are exhausted.
This Sphere of Influence emphasizes martial prowess, particularly as it relates to combat and overcoming tactical challenges that might arise during a Quest.
The general term for a Character or Objective that is the object of an action.
This tracks the level of risk you take on during a Quest. Your Threat increases at the end of each round and when you travel. If you reach 50 Threat, you fail the Quest.
Found only on Hero cards, this number is added to the Threat meter at the beginning of any Quest in which you use the Hero.
A card with this keyword increases each player's Threat by one additional point at the end of each round.
This term is used to designate to which category a Character belongs, whether determined by species, clan, or other criteria.

At the start of each round, upkeep occurs: your Threat increases by a minimum of 1, all exhausted cards ready, player and Sauron Resources are refreshed, and you draw 1 card from your player deck. Certain abilities may also activate at this time.
The great soldier-Orcs of Mordor and Isengard. An Anglicization of “Uruk-hai.”
The Black Speech term for Uruks. (See Uruk.)
Bonus Valor Points awarded when playing on Hard difficulty.
Rewards you get for completing Quests and daily challenges, or gain from Palantir views or other actions in the game. You can spend Valor Points on Quests, Heroes, cards, avatars, and more.
This keyword refers to an ability that triggers when this card defeats another.
A Character with this keyword does not exhaust after it takes its first action.
An Attachment trait. A Character can have only one Attachment of each trait at a time.
A Character's effectiveness when engaging an Objective.
